WRITING.TITLE: Relatively new to mods.
WRITING.TEXT: Is there a moon path to Elsweyr mod for SE? I've completed forgotten city and it was awesome. Which other mods are worth trying?
Which armour are you wearing?
I would fix all the problems facing my clients with dementia without losing my job then rob a bank!
Bring yourself. I work with people who are almost dying from loneliness.
There are no gods. The world is what we make it. Religion is only a tool to control the masses.
You got there before me!
Me too.
Issues. Many, many issues.

WRITING.TITLE: Driving and head banging.
WRITING.TEXT: I was driving home from a very long morning shift at work, I was listening to local radio. When bohemian rhapsody started playing I, naturally, started singing along. I was nearing my house when, as any person of my generation would, I started head banging at the appropriate moment in the song. As I looked up to check for traffic I saw the most awesome sight. The woman coming towards me was also head banging along to bohemian rhapsody.
She is sworn to carry her burdens.
Thanks, she must be dead. Checked breezhome a few times. Time to find myself another companion.
I miss her?

WRITING.TITLE: Lost Lydia!
WRITING.TEXT: I was reading a post yesterday thinking "how on earth did people manage to loose Lydia?" Well, now I've lost Lydia, no idea where I left her, I didn't ask her to wait anywhere but she's gone. Any advice on how to find her?
You will!
I love them all but the witchers beautiful scenery and really dark story make me think I'd go for it. If i really had to choose!
Fallout 4 or maybe the Witcher wild hunt...skyrim? So hard to choose.
Skydiving.
Have you looked at your own post? Check the top right corner!
Yes I think you may be right but it is cute.
Yes they do, they told me.
This is brilliant. I would definitely hang it on my wall.
I love this. I think it's a pretty good introduction. I wonder what it would say if it was written today.
It's a good start. I would like to see where it leads.
It seems like it could be a pretty enjoyable story but you need someone to proof read for you as it doesn't quite flow the way it should.
